title: Hủ Tiếu Nam Vang (Phnom Penh Noodles)
description: A clear, aromatic pork-and-seafood noodle soup featuring tender pork, shrimp, and a savory pork bone broth finished with fried garlic and fresh herbs. Bright, lightly seasoned, and texturally varied with chewy rice noodles, crunchy bean sprouts, and soft toppings.

ingredients.display_name: pork neck or shoulder, bone-in, cut into large chunks
ingredients.notes: for broth; can use combination of meat and bones
traditional but optional; poached briefly in broth

ingredients.display_name: dried flat rice noodles (hủ tiếu) or fresh if available
ingredients.notes: soak or cook according to package; enough for 4 bowls
thinly sliced; half fried for garnish, half used for broth
used for frying and aroma in broth

ingredients.display_name: scallions (green onions), white and green parts separated
ingredients.notes: white parts for broth, greens for garnish

ingredients.display_name: bok choy or choy sum, blanched

ingredients.notes: about 4.2 liters to cover bones and make broth

steps.text: Prepare bones and meat: blanch pork bones and pork chunks in a large pot of boiling water for 5 minutes to remove impurities, then drain and rinse under warm water.

Make the broth: return cleaned bones and pork to a large stockpot, add water to cover, bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer and skim foam for clarity. Add half the sliced shallots and the white parts of the scallions. Simmer gently for 2 hours, partially covered.

Prepare aromatics and fried shallots: while broth simmers, thinly slice remaining shallots and smash garlic. Heat oil in a small skillet over medium heat and fry sliced shallots until golden brown and crisp, about 6–8 minutes, removing and draining on paper towels. Reserve flavored oil for finishing.

Strain and season broth: after simmering, remove bones and large meat, strain broth through a fine sieve into a clean pot. Trim and thinly slice cooked pork meat for serving. Season broth with fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, white pepper and salt; simmer 10 minutes to meld flavors and adjust seasoning.

Poach proteins: bring broth to a gentle simmer and add raw shrimp briefly (about 1–2 minutes) until opaque and cooked through; remove and set aside. If using pork liver, slide thin slices into simmering broth for 30–45 seconds until just cooked; remove and set aside.

Prepare noodles and vegetables: cook rice noodles according to package instructions (soak or blanch) until tender but firm, drain and divide into serving bowls. Blanch bok choy or choy sum briefly in boiling water for 30 seconds and drain. Rinse bean sprouts if using raw.

Assemble bowls: arrange noodles, blanched greens, bean sprouts, sliced pork, shrimp, and liver in bowls. Ladle hot strained broth over the bowl to warm and cover ingredients. Top with fried shallots, chopped scallion greens, cilantro, a drizzle of reserved scallion oil or fried garlic oil, a squeeze of lime and white pepper to taste.
Serve with condiments: provide chili, additional fish sauce or lime wedges on the side for diners to adjust seasoning. Serve immediately while hot.
